page.title: 01Wembworthy Centre & Environs
page.content: The area is essentially one of rolling farmland and forestry commission plantations on the remains of the fourth Earl of Portsmouths estate whose county seat (now a ruin) is to be found. In Heywood Wood is to be found a motte and bailey thought to be an Iron Age fortificaiton with Norman Additions. The local farms are all connected with the Portsmouth Estate broken up in circa 1913 and are of Yeomen type in terms of their inhabitants Visitors to the Wembworthy Centre (mainly from Devon) make full use of the local resources in the form of woodland and village trails, woods and lanes for navigational exercises and visit the settlement of Bridge Rowe where the former blacksmiths forge is now a craft centre
